prompt: Evaluate the impact of cloud computing on modern business infrastructure.

criteria.name: Understanding of Cloud Concepts
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of cloud computing models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and their business applications.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly explains multiple models and maps each to relevant business use cases.
performance_descriptors.good: Accurately describes 1–2 models and gives examples.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions cloud models but with limited detail.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic or unclear understanding of models.
performance_descriptors.poor: Fails to explain cloud computing accurately.

criteria.name: Analysis of Business Impact
criteria.description: Evaluates how cloud technology affects cost, scalability, and operations.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully discusses cost savings, agility, and risk tradeoffs.
performance_descriptors.good: Explains basic benefits like flexibility or cost reduction.
performance_descriptors.average: Makes general claims without detailed analysis.
performance_descriptors.poor: No clear link to business outcomes.

criteria.name: Use of Real-World Examples
criteria.description: Incorporates actual or realistic examples of companies using cloud infrastructure.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Provides multiple well-explained examples with relevance.
performance_descriptors.good: Provides at least one relevant example.

criteria.name: Structure and Academic Style
criteria.description: Presents arguments in a well-structured, formal academic tone.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly coherent essay with formal tone and logical flow.

key_points: Understand and differentiate between IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS cloud models.
Map each cloud model to a real business use case.
Evaluate the impact of cloud computing on cost reduction, operational agility, and scalability.
Include real-world examples of businesses using cloud infrastructure effectively.
Write using a formal, academic structure with clear argumentation and logical flow.
llm_questions: What are the key differences between IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS?
How does cloud computing reduce operational costs for businesses?
Can you provide real examples of companies using cloud services?
What are the security and scalability benefits of using the cloud?
How does cloud computing support digital transformation?
llm_answers: IaaS offers virtualized resources, PaaS supports app development, and SaaS delivers software over the internet.
By shifting to the cloud, companies avoid hardware costs and pay only for what they use.
Netflix uses AWS for global content delivery; Dropbox runs its infrastructure on hybrid cloud.
Cloud services offer scalability through auto-scaling and better security via centralized updates.
Cloud platforms enable rapid innovation, remote access, and integration with AI and analytics tools.
submissions.final_submission: Cloud computing has transformed how businesses operate by offering scalable, cost-effective solutions. Companies can adopt IaaS for infrastructure flexibility, PaaS for development, and SaaS for productivity tools. For example, Netflix uses AWS to deliver content globally, and startups leverage Google Cloud to reduce deployment time. The cloud enables rapid digital transformation, supporting scalability, agility, and data-driven decisions.

feedback.c1: Excellent understanding of cloud service models with business relevance clearly demonstrated.
feedback.c2: Strong, detailed evaluation of cost, scalability, and strategic impact.
feedback.c3: Relevant and diverse real-world examples used effectively.
feedback.c4: Clear, logical flow with formal tone throughout the essay.

key_points: Define cloud service models with at least one clear example (e.g., SaaS).
Explain how businesses benefit from the cloud in terms of cost and flexibility.
Mention at least one company that uses cloud services.
Maintain a clear structure with mostly formal tone.
llm_questions: What is SaaS and how do companies use it?
Can cloud computing help businesses save money?
What is a company that uses cloud technology?
Is cloud more scalable than traditional servers?
Why is cloud important in business?
llm_answers: SaaS is software accessed online, like Google Docs or Zoom.
Yes, businesses save money on servers and IT staff.
Amazon and Dropbox use cloud to manage storage and services.
Yes, cloud can grow with the business more easily.
Cloud allows flexibility and remote work.
submissions.final_submission: Cloud computing helps companies by offering services like SaaS. They don’t need to buy expensive servers and can use tools like Google Docs. Amazon and other companies use cloud to store data and run apps. It’s scalable and helps employees work from anywhere. That’s why many businesses are moving to the cloud.

feedback.c1: Accurate explanation of SaaS with examples, but limited coverage of other models.
feedback.c2: Mentions cost savings and flexibility but lacks deeper analysis.
feedback.c3: Good example provided; could benefit from more elaboration.
feedback.c4: Structure is clear; tone mostly formal with minor lapses.

Attempt to organize the response even if lacking technical depth.

feedback.c2: General comments on benefits without concrete details.
feedback.c4: Some structure present; lacks academic tone.
